intro: Bifaria platystachya, commonly known as the broad-stemmed bifaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
